smart_goals.description: By June 30, 2023, decrease my HbA1c from 9.2 to 7.0.
By May 31, 2023, increase my daily step count to 10,000 steps per day.
By July 31, 2023, reduce my daily sodium intake to less than 2,300 milligrams.
Exercise for 30 minutes each day.
Maintain a healthy diet with balanced nutrients.
Keep a food diary to track daily calorie and carbohydrate intake.
By next visit, I will walk 30 minutes a day, 5 days a week to help lose weight and reduce stress.
I will monitor my blood pressure at home twice a week and share the results with my healthcare provider to make sure it stays under control.
By next visit, I will keep my daily calorie intake to 1500 calories or less to help manage my weight and diabetes.
Increase vegetable intake to 2 servings per day by tracking intake in a food diary for the next 2 weeks
Implement a medication reminder system, such as setting alarms or using a pill box, to ensure adherence to medication regimen within the next week
Exercise for at least 30 minutes, 5 days a week for the next month, with the aim of improving cardiovascular health and blood sugar control
Limit daily sugar intake to 25 grams
Exercise 30 minutes, 5 days per week
Check blood sugar level 2 times per day
By the next visit, maintain a diet of 1,500 calories or less per day to help manage diabetes.
In the next week, monitor blood sugar levels four times a day to identify patterns and adjust medication as needed.
Increase physical activity to 30 minutes of moderate exercise most days of the week within the next month to improve overall health.
By the end of the year, I want to lose 10 pounds to reduce my risk of diabetes complications.
I will walk for 30 minutes, 5 days a week to improve my cardiovascular health.
I will monitor my blood sugar levels daily and keep a record of my readings.
Exercise for 30 minutes a day to reduce stress and improve blood sugar levels.
Limit alcohol consumption to one drink per day to improve blood sugar control.
Avoid smoking to reduce the risk of complications associated with diabetes.
Reduce blood glucose level to 100 mg/dL by the end of the month.
Eat a balanced diet for one week to maintain a healthy weight.
Exercise for at least 30 minutes a day, five days a week to lower blood sugar levels.
Increase physical activity by taking 10,000 steps per day for the next month.
Maintain a healthy weight by eating a balanced diet and limiting junk food for the next three months.
Manage blood sugar levels by monitoring them regularly and adjusting medication as needed for the next six months.
